intro: Alangium chinense var. nipponicum, commonly known as Japanese alangium, is a deciduous shrub native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
